text: Lauren Perry (born 5 April 2001) is a Northern Irish footballer who plays as a goalkeeper for Forfar Farmington in the Scottish Women's Premier League and the Northern Ireland national team. ==Club career== In March 2017, Perry signed for Linfield, the club where her father, Alan Perry, was assistant first team coach. She made her Linfield debut in a 5–2 win against Sion Swifts on 22 March 2017. On 22 August 2017, Perry made her Champions League debut in a 2017–18 qualifying round match against PK-35 Vantaa. In her first season with the club she was named Women's Premiership player of the year and NIFWA Women’s Personality of the Year. On 2 October 2019, Perry signed with Blackburn Rovers in the English FA Women's Championship. ==International== On 15 September 2018, Perry made her senior international debut for Northern Ireland in a 2019 FIFA Women's World Cup qualifying defeat to Norway. She made nine saves and was voted player of the match. ==Honours== ===Club=== Linfield * NIFL Women's Premiership: 2017, 2018, 2019 * NIFL Women's Premiership League Cup: 2018 ==References== ==External links== * * * Category:2001 births Category:Living people Category:Blackburn Rovers L.F.C. players Category:Women's association footballers from Northern Ireland Category:Northern Ireland women's international footballers Category:Women's association football goalkeepers Category:Forfar Farmington F.C. players Category:Linfield Ladies F.C. players Category:Women's Premiership (Northern Ireland) players
title: Lauren Perry
